Title: WHIRLIGIG
Content: Pioneers were definitely handy with a needle and thread, as clothes, blankets, pillows, and most other items were made by hand. Frontier children made this toy if their mother had an extra button. If she didn't, they might have been lucky enough for their father to whittle them a button, and then the same toy was called a buzzsaw.
piece of string twice as long as your arm
Thread the string through the buttonholes. Tie the ends in a knot, forming a loop.
Hold each end of the string, so that the button is in the middle.
Swing the button in a circle to wind up the string.
Pull your hands apart and push them together again. The button will whirl and sing as it swings.
